commitResults.messageTitle: Added task addition, task memory and task list feature
Added support for tracking 3 types of tasks: ToDo, Deadline, Event
Added automated tests for user commands
Switched to using ArrayList to store tasks
Added delete functionality and updated automated test
Add filter command to print deadlines/events on specific date
Add Command classes and Parser class
A-Gradle: Add Gradle support and configure main class as kira.Kira
Make changes to package the app as a JAR file
Add JavaDoc for core classes and methods
Use checkStyle to detect and correct coding violations

commitResults.messageBody:
Tests and several core classes show style and safety issues:
* test imports and newlines violate Checkstyle
* internal lists and message lists are exposed
* date formatters are repeatedly created
* UI scanner is not closeable.

These problems reduce maintainability, allow accidental state mutation,
produce Checkstyle noise, waste allocations, and risk resource leaks.

Let's,
* normalize tests to pass Checkstyle and modernize assertions.
* centralize repeated literals/formatters and mark immutable fields
final.
* return defensive copies/unmodifiable views for exposed collections.
* add a Ui.close() hook for resource cleanup.

Apply small, low-risk refactors that improve safety and readability
without breaking public APIs; prefer defensive copying and constants to
prevent bugs and reduce duplication.

All tests pass and test Checkstyle report is clean for modified files.
No breaking API changes introduced; Ui.close() is additive.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/kira/CommandResult.java
#	src/main/java/kira/task/TaskList.java
#	src/test/java/kira/KiraHandleCommandTest.java
#	src/test/java/kira/ParserTest.java
#	src/test/java/kira/command/FindCommandTest.java
#	src/test/java/kira/task/EventTest.java
#	src/test/java/kira/task/TaskListTest.java
#	src/test/java/kira/task/ToDoTest.java

Improve code quality

Tests and several core classes show style and safety issues:
* test imports and newlines violate Checkstyle
* internal lists and message lists are exposed
* date formatters are repeatedly created
* UI scanner is not closeable.

These problems reduce maintainability, allow accidental state mutation,
produce Checkstyle noise, waste allocations, and risk resource leaks.

Let's,
* normalize tests to pass Checkstyle and modernize assertions.
* centralize repeated literals/formatters and mark immutable fields
final.
* return defensive copies/unmodifiable views for exposed collections.
* add a Ui.close() hook for resource cleanup.

Apply small, low-risk refactors that improve safety and readability
without breaking public APIs; prefer defensive copying and constants to
prevent bugs and reduce duplication.

All tests pass and test Checkstyle report is clean for modified files.
No breaking API changes introduced; Ui.close() is additive.

The application currently does not provide an undo command for mutating
operations; users cannot revert recently performed add/delete/mark
actions for tasks.

Users expect to be able to correct recent mistakes; without undo the UI
is less forgiving and test workflows (and manual use) are harder to
recover from.

Let's,
* Add a minimal snapshot-based undo mechanism: implement Task.copy() and
TaskList.copy()/replaceWith(), add UndoCommand and Parser support for
undo, mark mutating commands as undoable, maintain an in-memory undo
stack in Kira, and restore/save the previous snapshot when undo is
invoked.
* Add unit tests that cover undoing ToDo, Deadline, Event additions and
undoing marks.
* Use a snapshot approach because it is simple and reliable across
different task types (ToDo/Deadline/Event) and avoids writing
per-command inverse logic.
* Handle undo centrally in Kira to keep command implementations small
and to ensure storage is updated after a restore.

Note: undo history is kept in-memory only (not persisted across
restarts) and may increase memory usage for very large task lists;
tests for the new behavior were added (command/UndoCommandTest and
command/UndoDeadlineEventTest) and exercise add/delete/mark undo
scenarios.

Checkstyle reports violations in both main and test sources (missing
Javadoc on constructors, wildcard static imports, import-order issues,
and overly long test lines), causing the Gradle check task to fail.

Style enforcement is part of the CI/build pipeline and prevents
successful builds; addressing these violations is required to keep the
codebase consistent and maintainable.

Let's,
* Add missing Javadoc comments to the Storage(String) and Ui()
constructors
* Replace import static ... .* uses in tests with explicit assertion
imports
* Reorder imports in DeadlineTest; and split long predicate lines in
UndoDeadlineEventTest so they comply with line-length rules
* Re-run Checkstyle to confirm fixes

Make minimal, low-risk, cosmetic edits that satisfy the existing
Checkstyle rules without changing runtime behaviour or test semantics.
This fixes CI failures quickly and keeps changes easy to review.

All tests and Checkstyle now pass locally; these changes only affect
documentation and test formatting (file edits: Storage.java, Ui.java, UndoDeadlineEventTest.java, KiraHandleCommandTest.java,
UndoCommandTest.java, DeadlineTest.java, etc.).

UI currently shows dialog bubbles and text that lack a consistent
palette, rich-text support, and reliable reflow on window resize.

This degrades readability (dark-on-dark text, invisible outlines) and
causes avatars/messages to detach from the window edges when the window
is resized.

Let's,
* Add the Kira color palette: #0C0F25, #1D6380, #0C172E, #182759,
#0B0B1E.
* Implement simple markup support for Kira messages and apply text-flow
styling.
* Make dialog area responsive: set ScrollPane fit-to-width,
sync dialogContainer width with viewport, set DialogBox pref/max widths,
update Text wrapping widths on viewport changes, and use a spacer +
grouped bubble/avatar layout to pin user messages to the right and Kira
to the left.

Do it this way to guarantee consistent, accessible contrast and
predictable layout without a full HTML engine:
* Palette enforces visual consistency.
* Inline markup + TextFlow keeps styling lightweight and controllable
per-span.
* Viewport-driven sizing + spacer groups ensure bubbles and avatars
remain pinned to edges and reflow cleanly as the window changes size.

Notes:
* User bubbles are capped to a compact max width while Kira uses the
full available width to optimize readability.
* Error messages use a dark red background with white text for clear
visibility.

The project currently lacks unit tests for several core components and
some existing tests use non-conforming names/imports; this makes
automated validation and future refactors riskier.

These areas need coverage to catch regressions early and to document
component contracts (Storage load/save, UI capture, command result
shape, mark/unmark behavior, and TaskList copy/replace semantics).

Let's,
* Add new JUnit tests for Storage, ResponseUi, CommandResult,
MarkCommand, and TaskList copy/replace
* Fix test naming/imports to satisfy Checkstyle and ensure tests run
cleanly.

Keep tests focused and small (happy-path + key edge checks) so they
validate behavior without being brittle; adjust test names and imports
to match project style and avoid linter failures.

All tests run locally and Checkstyle issues were resolved; no production
logic changes are required beyond small GUI parsing and responder tweaks
made to ensure placeholders render correctly in the GUI.
